title: England's 2007 Rugby World Cup remembered: Brian Ashton reveals truth about 'player rebellion'
text:
Martin Corry has a near perfect recall of every match that England played in the 2007 World Cup, the last time they reached a final. Yet when it comes to the 36-0 defeat by South Africa in the pool stages, Corry’s brain is almost completely blank as if he was suffering from a form of post-traumatic stress.

“Normally I am very good at being able to feel the emotions of certain occasions but I just can’t do it with that game and that dressing room,” Corry, the former England captain, said. “It was so bad that it was almost surreal. It is shellshock. You were looking around and there is no escape. You just have to stand there and take all the pain.”

A little more than a month later, England were...
description: Martin Corry has a near perfect recall of every match that England played in the 2007 World Cup, the last time they reached a final.
